Package ohos.utils

Class IntervalTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.utils.IntervalTimer

  • public abstract class IntervalTimer
extends Object
    Provides a timer for task execution that lasts for a while and repeats at regular intervals.

    Example code: 

     new IntervalTimer(60000, 3000) {
    @Override
     public void onInterval(long remain) {
         // This method will be called at the 3000th millisecond and repeatedly called every 3000 milliseconds.
     }

    @Override
     public void onFinish() {
         // This method will be called at the 60000th millisecond.
     }
 }.schedule();

    Note: IntervalTimer#onInterval(long) is synchronized. If the execution duration of this method is longer than the interval, the next call waits until the previous callback is complete. For example, if the interval is 3000 milliseconds, and the IntervalTimer#onInterval(long) callback lasts 4000 milliseconds, the first call is at the 3000th millisecond, and the next call is at the 9000th millisecond.

    Since:
    2

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      IntervalTimer​(long duration, long interval)
      Creates an IntervalTimer with a given work duration and interval.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void cancel​()
      Cancels the interval timer.
      abstract void onFinish​()
      Called when the total work duration of the interval timer is over.
      abstract void onInterval​(long remain)
      Called every time an interval starts.
      void schedule​()
      Starts the interval timer.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntervalTimer

        public IntervalTimer​(long duration,
                     long interval)
        Creates an IntervalTimer with a given work duration and interval.
        Parameters:
        duration - Indicates the work duration of the interval timer, in milliseconds, which cannot be less than the interval. When the work duration is over, IntervalTimer#onFinish() will be called to notify that the interval timer has gone off.
        interval - Indicates the interval time, in milliseconds, which is within the range of (1, duration]. Every time an interval starts, IntervalTimer#onInterval(long) is called to notify the remaining work time of the interval timer.
        Since:
        2

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public final void schedule​()
        Starts the interval timer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the interval is less than or equal to 0, or greater than the work duration.
        Since:
        2

      • cancel

        public final void cancel​()
        Cancels the interval timer.
        Since:
        2

      • onInterval

        public abstract void onInterval​(long remain)
        Called every time an interval starts.
        Parameters:
        remain - Indicates the remaining work time of the interval timer. The value may be duplicated due to precision.
        Since:
        2

      • onFinish

        public abstract void onFinish​()
        Called when the total work duration of the interval timer is over.
        Since:
        2
